page.title: 11Tump Farm,Whitebrook.
page.content: Tump Farm is in Whitebrook, near the River Wye. It is pasture land covering 120 acres. The farmer keeps a herd of 128 dairy cows, and 900 pigs, which he rears for their meat. The farmer obtains 900 litres of milk from the cows every day. 50 bottles of farm milk go to the milkman to deliver locally and the rest is taken by milk tanker to Gloucester. Sometimes the farmer goes to market, either in Monmouth or Gloucester, when he wants to sell a surplus of cows or pigs. This year he bred a large number of calves and piglets. The farmer's family helps on the farm. He does not employ anybody else. His day begins at 5.30a.m. & ends at about 7.30p.m. The cows are milked by machinery & the milk is stored in a large tank. It is a typical farm here.
